Artwork from @CristianEzeAla.

The Shell Gaming Dominion Project, aka SGDM for short, has been one intriguing ride. The current novel is being rebooted into three graphic issues in hopes of becoming a serial release. With 3 adapted scripts copy edited, I am willing to share my pains in trying to get a graphic series off the ground.

For starters, writing a 250 page novel is easier. That said, why?

  1. In novel writing the only main constraint is time
  2. Comic pages cost money (art, lettering, coloring)
  3. Most writing in a comic script is only for artist, layout, etc

I decided giving the artist more creative interpretation is better, being presently surprised with the outcome when the restraints are removed. That said, if a layout or cell isnâ€™t what you have in mind, you are going to have to wait longer and possible shell out more money.
